job description:

We're proud to be the only national distributor serving the entire continuum of healthcare.

Every single McKesson employee contributes to our mission—by joining McKesson Medical-Surgical you act as a catalyst in a chain of events that helps millions of people all over the globe. Your expertise, drive and passion can help us improve everything we touch, from providers to payors to pharmacies. Current Need

We are seeking a Data Scientist to join our team in Richmond, VA.

Position Description
McKesson Medical-Surgical (MMS) Data Scientist position will focus on advanced analytics geared towards promoting customer-benefiting intelligence which helps improve operational efficiency and patient health. This position will be based in our Richmond, VA office. The Data Analyst will collaborate with big data engineers in a cross functional team environment on various proof of concepts and on productionizing advanced analytics business applications on our Hadoop environments.

Responsibilities:
  • Meets and collaborates with business users on requirements, objectives and metrics
  • Performs exploratory data analysis, generates and tests working hypotheses, and uncovers noteworthy trends and relationship
  • Uses Big Data technologies to answer existing questions, as well as develop various data insights from the complete breadth of MMS data
  • Implement algorithms to power user-facing data-driven features
  • Be a champion for data sciences by helping business users understand algorithms outputs thru meaningful metrics and visualizations
  • Able to use sound judgment and prioritize tasks among multiple priorities
  • Results oriented, enthusiastic, creative thinker
  • Self-starter attitude with the ability to excel in dynamic work environments
Minimum Requirements
5 years experience in analytics or data related fields

Critical Skills
  • 3 years experience working with large, complex data systems to aggregate, organize, and prepare data for use in business analysis
  • 3 years experience using relevant software packages for statistical analyses and visualization (SQL, R, Spark, Python, Tableau/ Power BI)
  • 1 years experience working with Classification ML model
Additional Knowledge & Skills
  • Excellent communication skills with the ability to distill complex issues into structured frameworks and actionable insights
  • Experience in relational database concepts with a solid knowledge of SQL (PL/SQL knowledge preferred)
  • Experience with Hadoop and hive query language preferred
  • Ability to work independently in a fast paced, unstructured environment
  • Strong mathematical background with knowledge in at least one of the following fields: statistics, data mining, operations research, econometrics, and/or information retrieval (machine learning
  • Deep experience in extracting, cleaning, preparing and modeling data
  • Experience with Linux command-line scripting, data structures, and algorithms
  • Data visualization and presentation skills to effectively communicate data insights
  • Experience with Machine learning implementation on Azure or other public cloud platforms
Additional Knowledge & Skills
Demonstrated experience in bridging business requirement and technical development. Experience in working with large complex data systems to aggregate, organize, and preparing data for use in business analysis. Knowledge of data tools, such as SQL, NoSQL, Visual Basic, SAP, IBM, Neteeza, Teradata, Hadoop, and Oracle

Education
BA or BS degree or equivalent experience.

Physical Requirements
General Office Demands
